name: Meter
short_description: Displays a value within a defined range.

properties1.name: name
properties1.description: (mandatory) is the unique name of the field.

properties2.name: label
properties2.description: (mandatory) (translatable) is the descriptive title of the field.

properties3.name: width
properties3.description: (optional) is the width of meter box

properties7.name: active
properties7.description: (optional) lets the strips on the bar move

properties8.name: description
properties8.description: (optional) (translatable) is text that will be shown as a tooltip when the user moves the mouse over the drop-down box.

properties9.name: class
properties9.description: (optional) is a CSS class name for the HTML form field. If omitted this will default to 'text_area'.

properties10.name: min
properties10.description: (mandatory) this value is the min on the meter.

properties11.name: max
properties11.description: (mandatory) this value is the max on meter.

properties12.name: step
properties12.description: (mandatory) each option will be the previous option incremented by this integer, starting with the first value until the last value is reached.

properties13.name: showon
properties13.description: (optional) show this field on the bases of the value in another field. https://joomla.stackexchange.com/a/17682/2166

description: The Meter form field type displays a visual indicator representing a numeric value within a specified range. It is useful for showing progress, performance, or any measurable quantity with optional thresholds for low, high, and optimum values.
